intro: Phacelia davidsonii, commonly known as Davidson's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Phacelia davidsonii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
